node.statement: ULTRAMETRIC CASE ANALYSIS. Case (i): N(v₁) ≥ |α|N(v₃). Then N(v₁+αv₃)=N(v₁) by isosceles, so T₁ ≥ N(v₁+αv₃)N(w₁). Similarly for T₂. Then T₁+T₂ ≥ collapsed cost ≥ 1, and T₃≥0 gives C≥1. Case (ii): N(v₁) < |α|N(v₃). Then N(v₁+αv₃)=|α|N(v₃), so collapsed-term₁ = |α|N(v₃)N(w₁). Here T₁ < collapsed-term₁, so the deficit is |α|N(v₃)N(w₁)-T₁. Need T₃ ≥ this deficit. Since T₃=N(v₃)N(αw₁+βw₂) ≥ N(v₃)|α|N(w₁) (by N(αw₁+βw₂)≥|α|N(w₁) when |α|N(w₁)≥|β|N(w₂)), this gives T₃ ≥ |α|N(v₃)N(w₁) > T₁, so T₁+T₃ > collapsed-term₁. CHECK: does N(αw₁+βw₂) ≥ |α|N(w₁) always hold?
